CITIZEN_DETAILS.ADDRESS_FOR_SERVICE: This is known as an "address for service".
CITIZEN_DETAILS.ADDRESS_NOT_FOUND: We can't find an address for that postcode.
CITIZEN_DETAILS.ALL_CORRESPONDENCE: All correspondence will be sent to this address.

CITIZEN_PHONE.INFORMATION: We'll give your phone number to the person, business, or organisation claiming from you, or to their legal representative, if they have one.
CITIZEN_PHONE.MORE_INFORMATION: We will only call you if we need more information about this claim.
CITIZEN_PHONE.TITLE: Enter a phone number (optional)

CITIZEN_RESPONSE_TYPE.ACCEPT_OR_TRANSFER: They can accept the amount you've paid and settle the claim, or ask the court to transfer the claim to a County Court hearing centre.
CITIZEN_RESPONSE_TYPE.ADMIT_ALL_CANT_PAY: If you admit all of the claim but can't pay immediately, you can offer to pay the claimant in instalments.
CITIZEN_RESPONSE_TYPE.ADMIT_ALL_DEADLINE: You have until 4pm on {{ deadline }} to admit the claim.
CITIZEN_RESPONSE_TYPE.AGAINST_INDIVIDUAL: If the claim is against you as an individual, the hearing centre will be the nearest one to your home or business.
CITIZEN_RESPONSE_TYPE.CLAIMANT_ACCEPT_OFFER: If the claimant accepts your offer, they can ask the court to enter a CCJ against you and you'll be sent an order to pay.
CITIZEN_RESPONSE_TYPE.CLAIMANT_ACCEPT_PART_ADMISSION: If the claimant accepts your part-admission and you can't pay immediately, you can offer to pay in instalments.
CITIZEN_RESPONSE_TYPE.CLAIMANT_AGREES: If the claimant agrees, they can ask court to enter a CCJ against you and you'll be sent an order to pay.
CITIZEN_RESPONSE_TYPE.CLAIMANT_INDIVIDUAL: If the claimant is an individual and the claim is against you as an organisation, the hearing centre will be the nearest one to their home or business.
CITIZEN_RESPONSE_TYPE.CLAIMANT_RECEIPT: You should ask the claimant to give you a receipt.
CITIZEN_RESPONSE_TYPE.CLAIMANT_REJECT_OFFER: If the claimant rejects your offer, they can ask the court to enter a CCJ against you. The court will then decide the repayment plan.
CITIZEN_RESPONSE_TYPE.CLAIMANT_REJECT_PART_ADMISSION: If they reject your offer, the court will decide a repayment plan.
CITIZEN_RESPONSE_TYPE.FULL_ADMISSION: I admit all of the claim
CITIZEN_RESPONSE_TYPE.FULL_ADMISSION_HINT: You agree you owe the full amount claimed.
CITIZEN_RESPONSE_TYPE.FULL_DEFENCE_HINT: You've either paid what you believe you owe or you reject the claim.
CITIZEN_RESPONSE_TYPE.HOW_DO_YOU_RESPOND: How do you respond to the claim?
CITIZEN_RESPONSE_TYPE.IF_ADMIT_ALL: If you admit all of the claim and want to pay it in full, including interest and claim fee, contact the claimant to arrange payment.
CITIZEN_RESPONSE_TYPE.IF_ADMIT_ALL_AND_PAY: If you pay at the same time as admitting the claim, you won't get a County Court Judgment (CCJ).
CITIZEN_RESPONSE_TYPE.IF_PROCEED: If they proceed, the claim may be transferred to a County Court hearing centre.
CITIZEN_RESPONSE_TYPE.PART_ADMIT: To admit part of the claim, contact the claimant and pay the amount you believe you owe then send the court your part admission.
CITIZEN_RESPONSE_TYPE.PART_ADMIT_DEADLINE: You have until 4pm on {{ deadline }} to admit part of the claim.
CITIZEN_RESPONSE_TYPE.PART_ADMISSION_HINT: You agree you owe some money but not the full amount claimed.

REJECT_ALL_CLAIM_TYPE.ALREADY_PAID: I've paid what I believe I owe
REJECT_ALL_CLAIM_TYPE.COUNTER_CLAIM: I dispute the claim and want to make a counterclaim
REJECT_ALL_CLAIM_TYPE.DISPUTE: I dispute all of the claim

CITIZEN_RESPONSE_TYPE.REJECT_DEADLINE: You have until 4pm on {{ deadline }} to reject the claim.
CITIZEN_RESPONSE_TYPE.REJECT_PAID: If you reject because you believe you've paid the money, the claimant has 28 days to tell you and the court whether they're proceeding with the claim.
CITIZEN_RESPONSE_TYPE.REJECT_WHOLE_CLAIM: If you reject all of the claim, the claim may be transferred to a County Court hearing centre.
CITIZEN_RESPONSE_TYPE.RESPONSE_MEANING: Find out what each response means

EXPERT_GUIDANCE.ASK_PERMISSION: You must ask for permission to use an expert - a judge will then decide whether the expert is necessary.
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.COST_HIRING_EXPERT: The cost of hiring an expert depends on which expert you and the {{ otherParty }} choose.
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.EXPERT_REPORT: The expert will provide a written report - they won't usually come to court in person.
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.FOR_EXAMPLE: For example, they might allow a structural engineer to be used in a claim about building works or a mechanic in a claim about car repairs.
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.IF_JUDGE_ALLOWS: If a judge allows you to use an expert, you'll usually have to share one expert with the {{ otherParty }}.
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.IF_PERMISSION: If you get permission to use an expert
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.IF_YOU_WIN: If you win the case you may be able to recover a maximum of Â£750 of the cost you paid. A judge will rule on this at the end of the hearing.
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.JUDGE_ALLOW_EXPERT: A judge will only allow you to use an expert if they believe they need the expert's specialist knowledge.
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.JUDGE_DECIDE_COST: The judge will also decide whether the cost of the expert is reasonable compared to the value of the claim.
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.JUDGE_MAY_ASK: The judge may ask one of you to make a list of 3 independent experts who can provide a written report in return for a fee.
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.JUDGES_RESPONSIBLE_COST: Even though you and the {{ otherParty }} share the cost of hiring the expert, judges are still responsible for keeping costs in proportion to value.
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.MUST_AVOID_DISCUSSING: You must avoid discussing the case in detail with the 3 experts.
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.OTHER_PARTY_CHOOSES: The other party then chooses one expert from the list. After that, you both need to follow these steps
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.PAY_EXPERT: Pay the expert - you usually both share this cost.
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.PROVIDE_EXTRA: Provide any extra information the expert asks for.
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.PROVIDE_QUESTIONS: Provide questions for the expert to answer in a report.
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.RARE: It's rare for judges to allow you to use an expert in a small claim.
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.SEND_EXPERT_REPORT: Send the expert's report to the court (only one of you will have to do this).
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.TITLE: Using an expert in small claims
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.USUALLY_SHARE_COST: Usually you both share this cost.

EXPLANATION.TITLE: Briefly explain why you can't pay immediately

INCOMPLETE_SUBMISSION.TITLE: You need to complete all sections before you submit your response

LATEST_UPDATE_CONTENT.YOU_HAVENT_RESPONDED_TO_CLAIM: You haven't responded to this claim
LATEST_UPDATE_CONTENT.YOU_NEED_TO_RESPOND_BEFORE_DEADLINE: You need to respond before 4pm on {{ responseDeadline }} ({{ remainingDays }} Days remaining).
LATEST_UPDATE_CONTENT.CLAIMANT_CAN_ASK_FOR_CCJ_AGAINST_YOU: You haven't responded to the claim. {{ claimantName }} can now ask for a County Court Judgement against you.
LATEST_UPDATE_CONTENT.CCJ_COULD_SEND_BAILIFFS_TO_YOUR_HOME: A County Court Judgment can mean you find it difficult to get credit, like a mortgage or mobile phone contract. Bailiffs could also be sent to your home.
LATEST_UPDATE_CONTENT.YOU_CAN_STILL_RESPOND_TO_CLAIM: You can still respond to the claim before they ask for a judgment.

REQUEST_MORE_TIME.APPLY_TO_COURT: You need to apply to the court to request more time.
REQUEST_MORE_TIME.DOWNLOAD_FORM: Download form N244 (opens in new tab)
REQUEST_MORE_TIME.EMAIL_FORM: Email the completed form N244 to: contact@justice.gov.uk.
REQUEST_MORE_TIME.HOW_MUCH_ADDITIONAL_TIME: How much additional time are you asking for?
REQUEST_MORE_TIME.IF_AGREED: If agreed, extra time will start from {{ responseDeadline }}
REQUEST_MORE_TIME.NO_AGREEMENT: They do not have to agree to a request for more time.
REQUEST_MORE_TIME.POST: Or, you can post the completed form to:
REQUEST_MORE_TIME.SELECT_SAVE_AND_CONTACT: Select 'Save and continue' and contact {{ claimantName }}'s legal representative to request this.
REQUEST_MORE_TIME.TELL_OTHER_PARTY: You'll also need to tell the other party that you have applied to the court.
REQUEST_MORE_TIME.TITLE: Request more time to respond

SUPPORT_REQUIRED.ARRANGE_AND_PAY: You may have to arrange and pay for interpreters except for Welsh. The court will tell you.

SUPPORT_REQUIRED.WHAT_LANGUAGE: What language needs to be interpreted?

UNDERSTANDING_YOUR_OPTIONS.HOW_MUCH_EXTRA: How much extra time can you request?
UNDERSTANDING_YOUR_OPTIONS.REQUEST_EXTENSION_DEFAULT: If you want to request an extension of up to 28 days, you'll need to ask the other party's legal representative directly.
UNDERSTANDING_YOUR_OPTIONS.REQUEST_EXTENSION_MORE: If you want to request an extension of more than 28 days, or if your extension request has been rejected by the other party's legal representative, you'll need to apply to the court.
UNDERSTANDING_YOUR_OPTIONS.UNABLE_TO_RESPOND_BEFORE_DEADLINE: If you think that you will be unable to respond to a claim before this deadline, you can request more time.

VULNERABILITY.QUESTION_1: Question 1: Do you believe you, or a witness who will give evidence on your behalf, are vulnerable in anyway which the Court needs to consider?
VULNERABILITY.QUESTION_2: Question 2: If you have answered "yes" to question 1, in what way/s are you/ the witness vulnerable and what steps, support or adjustments do you wish the Court to consider?
VULNERABILITY.YOUR_ANSWERS: Your answers to the questions above will enable the court and the judge, to consider what steps, adjustments or support can be arranged.
VULNERABILITY.REMINDER: You are reminded that a copy of this directions questionnaire will be shared with all other parties.
VULNERABILITY.TITLE: Vulnerability Questions

YOU_HAVE_PAID_LESS.IF_CLAIMANT_REJECTS: If CLAIMANT_NAME rejects your explanation you might have to go to a hearing.

YOUR_DEFENCE.BRIEFLY: Briefly explain why you disagree with the claim
YOUR_DEFENCE.FAIL: If you fail to dispute any part of the claim the court may assume you admit it.
YOUR_DEFENCE.ACCEPT: You should also say if you accept any parts of the claim.
YOUR_DEFENCE.TIMELINE: Don't give us a detailed timeline - we'll ask for that separately.

YOUR_DEFENCE.REASON: Their reasons for making the claim
